  3. An Stuc

An Stuc

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

An Stuc was promoted to Munro status in 1997 and is the steepest and sharpest of the Ben Lawers range. When approaching from Meall Garbh the ascent is extremely steep, exposed and loose.

 You have not climbed An Stuc.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1118 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.03/5
Rating: 4.0/5 (145 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Circuit of Coire nan Cat

Other routes and challenges

The route given can easily by extended to take in Ben Lawers, descending initially down its eastern ridge. An Stuc could be climbed from the Ben Lawers car park, though unless intent on a traverse you would need to climb right back over Ben Lawers.

The biggest bagging route hereabouts is a circuit of the 7 Lawers Munros as part of a horseshoe round the Allt a' Chobhair from Camusvrachan in Glen Lyon.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages
